info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 30 at 3:43AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Manatee River At Rye Bridge affecting Manatee County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Manatee River Near Myakka Head at SR 64 affecting Manatee County. Alafia River At Lithia affecting Hillsborough County. Little Manatee River At Wimauma at US 301 affecting Hillsborough County. Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17 affecting Hardee County. Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. Peace River At Bartow affecting Polk County. Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72 affecting DeSoto County. For the Alafia...including Lithia , Riverview near US 301...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Little Manatee...including Wimauma at US 301...Major flooding is forecast. For the Manatee...including Myakka Head at SR 64, Rye Bridge...Major flooding is forecast. For the Myakka...including Myakka River State Park...Major flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Major flooding is forecast. For the Horse Creek...including Arcadia at SR 72...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 28.1 feet, Water reaches the U.S. 17 bridge roadbed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 27.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EDT Friday was 27.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 20.1 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Peace River Zolfo Springs at 16.0 27.2 Fri 2 am 24.7 20.9 20.1 19.8 19.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EDT.
